biotools.summary: Quantitative hyperspectral image unmixing (Q-HIU) method is intended for quantitative data analysis of multi-set and individual Raman micro-spectroscopy images, allowing to efficiently retrieve non-negative spatial concentration maps and non-negative spectral profiles of the images’ chemical constituents (components) with no a priori information, minimum input parameters, and great operation speed.

bioschemas.name: Q-HIU
bioschemas.summary: Quantitative hyperspectral image unmixing (Q-HIU) method is intended for quantitative data analysis of multi-set and individual Raman micro-spectroscopy images, allowing to efficiently retrieve non-negative spatial concentration maps and non-negative spectral profiles of the images’ chemical constituents (components) with no a priori information, minimum input parameters, and great operation speed.
